website_summaries.verdict: A timeless pan from a longstanding manufacturer of respected kitchenware. You can't go wrong with this dependable piece.
pros: Attractive bell-shaped lid with classic look
Stainless steel with heat-safe handles up to 350°F
cons: Some buyers say it isn't as heavy or durable as older versions of the pan

customer_reviews.title: So happy with this skillet!
customer_reviews.text: This skillet is everything I've come to expect with Farberware. Classic lines, well made, and performs like it cost much much more. After years of cooking with nonstick pans; I've went back to stainless steel for the culinary benefits. It cleans practically as quick as nonstick, does not scratch or peel, and sauteed foods come out so much better tasting and looking. Those who have trouble with food sticking need to browse the internet to learn the best technique for cooking with stainless steel.....yes, there IS a technique!
customer_reviews.author: River Girl

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight, easy to clean cookware.
customer_reviews.text: Bought Farberware cookware due to issue with lifting heavy pots and skillet. As an older individual my hand and wrist strength is not as good as it used to be. Farberware is a name I remembered from way back. Always looked beautiful. Ordered two pots and one skillet. All are lightweight and just as beautiful as I remember. Cleans up easily and can be put in the dishwasher if needed. Would definitely order again. Love them.
customer_reviews.author: SEE

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality
customer_reviews.text: Had this pan about 3 months and the handle is coming off. Plus, the inside of my pan seems to have some finish or something that is wearing off, really lame for a pan. My old Farberware pan was really old when it died but I won't buy this brand again.
customer_reviews.author: ISAIDFEROLITO

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.text: Very well made. Food cooks evenly. If you want a very large pan, it will work well. Just be aware that it is wider than most large burners, but this doesn't seem to be a problem because the entire pan heats evenly. One tip: We also bought the separately sold glass lid, and we prefer that so we can watch what's cooking. We highly recommend this!
customer_reviews.author: Rosie's mom

customer_reviews.title: Can't go wrong
customer_reviews.text: We still use the Farberware pots and pans set we received as a wedding gift - over 42 years ago! I know they aren't the fanciest or chef-friendly but for our everyday purposes, they have stood the test of time. This skillet was a replacement and we can't remember what happened to our old one. Maybe the handle came off or something. But all our other ones are still intact with no issues. We bought one by Giada de Laurentiis so we could have a non-stick skillet. That one did NOT last long at all and had to be thrown out.
customer_reviews.author: Cherri T

customer_reviews.title: More top quality from Farberware in this spacious fry pan
customer_reviews.text: My wife loves this extra large, high capacity fry pan from Farberware which I recently purchased to add to our existing set. We have had Farberware stainless steel cookware for 33 years now, all the originals going strong with only a couple of replaced handles along the way (and replacement parts were easily found and inexpensive, too). You really can't ask more of cookware than that. Keep it up, Farberware!
customer_reviews.author: StanM

customer_reviews.title: Non-stick and cleans up beautifully!
customer_reviews.text: I've used Farberware pans for over 35 years and have always liked them. I had a skillet that got lost in a move, so I bought this to replace it and couldn't be happier. It's as non-stick as a cast iron, but cleans up easily with no worries about rusting. And the lid is a bonus! Nice price, too!
customer_reviews.author: Berrywood

customer_reviews.title: Terrific line of pans
customer_reviews.text: Farberware has the most reasonably priced stainless steel pans. They are sturdy and well made. I like that the pans come with matching covers. We are tired of throwing out the "non-stick" pans when the coating starts to come off, which happens way too fast. The Farberware pans are easy to clean and food doesn't stick, if you know how to cook. Yes, you sometimes have to use oil or fat, but the result is so much tastier.
customer_reviews.author: PJ

customer_reviews.title: A good pan
customer_reviews.text: I'm slowly getting rid of my teflon pans and going to stainless steel. This replaces a thirty-five year old pan and I should have done it a long time ago. It works great just watch your temps and oil it before using it. When done using it put a little water in it and heat while scraping any burnt or sticking food, easy to clean then.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect addition.
customer_reviews.text: I own some very heavy duty All-Clad Cooking and Baking Pans which I have used for years. However there are times I prefer a quick, lighter duty pan and I find the Farberware Classic a suitable and satisfactory line of cookware that works very satisfactorily with the heavier pans. With Farberware of this quality I never feel my cooking is sacrificed nor do I feel I have to work harder to produce desired results.
customer_reviews.author: ROY-MICHEL B.

customer_reviews.title: Burn food come off easily. Set the pot aside
customer_reviews.text: I have used my Faberware Classic Series pot and fry pans for the past 30 years. This was a replacement for the one that I had accidentally thrown away. Burn food come off easily. Set the pot aside, in a couple of days the burn food will dry up and it is ready to be washed. These are better than any Teflon pots.
customer_reviews.author: Patty

customer_reviews.title: Handle melted
customer_reviews.text: It’s a nice pan, holds a good bit, but the handle is apparently not heat resistant. I have a gas range and had the pan centered over a burner, and the heat from the range melted the handle, which was not over the burner. I would not recommend for this reason.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Unhappy
customer_reviews.text: I’ve used Farberware pots and pans for years. I had no idea anything had been changed but the reviews were correct. I used the skillet once and there are spots in the pan. Not satisfied with that at all. Disappointed but did not return it. Will not buy again.unhappy
customer_reviews.author: K Terr

customer_reviews.title: Farberware Classic Series 10" Skillet
customer_reviews.text: We bought this to replace one we've had for over 20 years. I absolutely love that it's a little deeper than the original and that I could still match the rest of my Farberware.
customer_reviews.author: Denise Baldwin

customer_reviews.title: Not as Heavy as Old Version
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this pan as a replacement for one we have had for 30 years. Replaced because of handle falling off after the 30 year usage. The new pan feels so much lighter than the old pan but I am hoping it will conduct heat and cook as well as the old one. My husband has suggested finding some stainless steel screws to plug the holes where the handle use to be so that I can still use it.
customer_reviews.author: Miztrial

customer_reviews.title: Really heavy, not as non-stick as I'd like.
customer_reviews.text: Good pan for making quantities of sauce (marinara) or jam. VERY heavy, I have to use both hands even when it's empty. Just fried some onions and liver with plenty of fat in the bottom, and it still stuck and required a scrubber to get clean. Very handsome.
customer_reviews.author: Chena

customer_reviews.title: Love 'em
customer_reviews.text: Gotta love the classics! I recently purchased this pan and a 6-quart pot for use with an induction burner. I found that the stainless pots I own would not work on induction, so I was looking for something that would work well. I haven't owned Farberware in many years, but I love the retro look and familiar quality of the pan. It does the job, cleans up well, and works GREAT on induction burners. Still a great value after all these years!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Fan

customer_reviews.title: Pan a plus, handle is not
customer_reviews.text: I love this product and brand. My only complaint is that the handle has already come off and we haven't figured out to reapply it. It is still useable, just wish the handle was still there. Will definitely take suggestions from people that may have had the same experience as to how they repplied the handle. ☺
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Same great quality!
customer_reviews.text: I always loved the Farberware quality. I had received this pan in 1990 as a wedding present and it was still in great condition until my daughter brought it to a function and it disappeared. I found it on Amazon and it's virtually the same!! Love it!!
customer_reviews.author: Karen A. Perricone

customer_reviews.title: The food doesn’t stick , not heavyweight , easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: I love these pots (the classic ones). I have them 20 years ago. I give old pots to my sister and buy new ones for me. They are good for everything in the kitchen, easy to clean and do not heavyweights , I have arthritis, the food does not stick. Some people say that the food sticks, is because they use too much heat when they are cooking, and forget about the pot that They have on the stove. For me they are spectacular. I recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: Martha L. Mejia

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: I have used this pan several times, it Cooks really fast. There is definitely a learning curve, but the pan itself is very well made and I see it lasting looks likely for the rest of my life
customer_reviews.author: Shannon

customer_reviews.title: Very heavy base
customer_reviews.text: Purchased to add to an old set of Farberware Classic Series Stainless Steel pots and pans from the 80s. Looks the same but the construction is different. The base is heavier, thicker and lid is thinner, lighter. Don't know if that is better or not. I've only used it a few times, but I like it.
customer_reviews.author: CJM

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy pan
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy pan but things stick to it and it is a little hard to clean. Not what I expected. It is still well made and I will use it for cooking some things.
customer_reviews.author: Stargirl

customer_reviews.title: Favorite Pan
customer_reviews.text: My go to Farberware stainless steel frypan after 50 yrs died on me, so I picked the same pan to replace it, the handle on lid is different but same weight and feel... hopefully it will outlast me😎
customer_reviews.author: Donna Paxton

customer_reviews.title: a great frying pan
customer_reviews.text: This is a good feeling pan in the hand, not too heavy to hold, and is excellent quality. It is very important to heat the pan first, then add your shortening, butter or whatever and then the food. Washes clean so easy. If food has stuck to the bottom, just soak in dishsoap and water. Then you can use a paper towel to wipe away the parts that had stuck to the bottom....it's that easy. I am so happy to get away from the non-stick pans as they don't last very long & soon have the bottom peeling or flaking & I don't want that in our food. Thank you for a good pan.
customer_reviews.author: Linda from Nebraska

customer_reviews.title: Handle came off - Nut on handle is not welded from the inside
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for a year and have to throw it in the trash. The screw that holds on the handle is supposed to be welded from inside. The handle comes loose and when you go to tighten it the screw just spins and spins because the nut inside is free. I have a feeling this is a counterfeit product. Farberware is better than this.
customer_reviews.author: Moriya Harpster

customer_reviews.title: I love this pan!
customer_reviews.text: I have had this pan (11 inches) for over 30 years and had to order a new one as I accidently burned the bottom of the pan from a grease fire.. It was as great size but I guess it is not available any longer in 11 inches. The 12" was too big and the 10" a tad too small but it is great to have this wonderful pan back in my kitchen. My Farberware pans have lasted a long time and even with my All-Clad pans I still prefer this one. No matter how burned the pan gets it washes up well (unless it catches fire).
customer_reviews.author: TreeTown

customer_reviews.title: Very Versatile!
customer_reviews.text: I love this pan! Farberware rarely disappoints. Great for frying bacon or simmering a gravy. Definitely would buy again!
customer_reviews.author: Lauri Cummins

customer_reviews.title: Pan
customer_reviews.text: This was a replacement for for an older Faberware pan. It has hotspots and is thinner than the previous model. I do like the size.
customer_reviews.author: aon

customer_reviews.title: Review of 10" Faberware Fry Pan
customer_reviews.text: I like the Frypan and the only problem with it is that it is not 10 inches. I wanted a 10 inch pan but this one will fit inside of my aluminum 10 inch pan. I wanted Stainless steal instead of aluminum. Other than that, I like it. I bought a 12 " Frypan and it is 12 inches, I don't know why this one is smaller than 10 inches. This pan is 9 1/2 inches or maybe a little less. Other than that, I really like the pan.
customer_reviews.author: Ron Hens

customer_reviews.title: Farberware Stainless Steel Cookware Rocks!
customer_reviews.text: I've used Farberware cookware for over 30 years. I've never been disappointed with this cookware.
customer_reviews.author: Joyce M. Hawkins

customer_reviews.title: LOVE THE OLD STYLE FARBERWARE
customer_reviews.text: Love the old Farberware that is the aluminum clad. Don't like the non-stick stuff that is out now. This item is great. Had to order online as could not find it in the stores. Just use PAM so food does not stick. Cleans with an SOS pad. Use stainless steel cleaner on bottom. Works great frying in high temps. Sometimes old stuff is better than new ideas.
customer_reviews.author: R. Gee

customer_reviews.title: good  heavy  stainless  pan
customer_reviews.text: a little heavier that I thought it would be.. but good for sautéing vegetable and chicken
customer_reviews.author: Lee

customer_reviews.title: Classic cookware
customer_reviews.text: Classic! I have tried many other brands and I always come back to Farberware.
customer_reviews.author: tsp2cak

customer_reviews.title: Handle issues
customer_reviews.text: This pan has flaws the major one being the handle isn't sturdy enough to hold the weight of the pan. I have only used it a few times since I bought it and the handle already fell off. The screw holding the handle isn't even long enough to secure it properly.
customer_reviews.author: Lolos C

customer_reviews.title: A great skillet
customer_reviews.text: Farberware has been around a very long time. I love their classic pans good old fashion stainless steel. You can beat these to death and they still come out looking new . This pan is no exception! I’m
customer_reviews.author: Vicky Urbaniak

customer_reviews.title: Handle broke off after two uses
customer_reviews.text: The handle broke off after only a few times. Why are tiny rivets used on such a heavy pan? I can't fix it. Waste of money. I'll never buy Farberware again
customer_reviews.author: Nanette Jaeger

customer_reviews.title: Great Pan!
customer_reviews.text: Size, Farberware finish, easy to clean and use. I love this pan!
customer_reviews.author: Janice K.

customer_reviews.title: It is a solid piece to add to a new set.
customer_reviews.text: I had to add it to the set I purchased, as I needed a larger skillet.
customer_reviews.author: James Corbidge II

customer_reviews.title: No fancy gimmicks!
customer_reviews.text: Phasing out the non stick pans because of the toxins released while cooking. These are the same great quality I remember from 40 years ago!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best pan ever
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE THIS PAN!!! From now on, I will only buy Faberware. They are the best! Lightweight, easy to clean. Can go in the dishwasher. Don't have to worry about only using plastic utensils. Have bought other brands in the past and bottons got scatched, handles came off. Faberware has a great reputation and they have earned it.
customer_reviews.author: T Toms

customer_reviews.title: I Can Count on Farberware
customer_reviews.text: I own a set of Farberware pots that are 30 years old. This is a larger fryer that perfect for sauteeing veggies. I love the all-stainless steel style; it does NOT have teflon/non-stick coating, but Farberware is a breeze to clean.
customer_reviews.author: conscious9676

customer_reviews.title: Food cooks on a little more but an overnight soak and clean up is easy. Got tired of replacing Teflon every year and ...
customer_reviews.text: Was exactly what we were looking for to replace the Teflon pan. Food cooks on a little more but an overnight soak and clean up is easy. Got tired of replacing Teflon every year and wanted another pan with the encapsulated base. Had to tighten the screw under the handle after a few uses but I think all pans do that. Holding up great so far.
customer_reviews.author: Chris D Rock

customer_reviews.title: Good, heavy pan with a lid.
customer_reviews.text: This pan is a great size and has a lid--which is not easy to find. My one problem is trying to get it to look clean, although I know it is. I still have some stains, which I have not been able to remove by washing. I plan to try a stainless steel powder next, but I hope I don't have to do this each time the pan is used. The pan cooks well, and I am happy to have it.
customer_reviews.author: Good Cook

customer_reviews.title: I thought it was the same as one I had ...
customer_reviews.text: I thought it was the same as one I had since 1970 that I had since discarded. It measures smaller than 10". I still have the Dutch oven pot and the lid was interchangeable with my old friying pan. It's too large for this new frying pan. Not the "classic" as makes one think it is 😁
customer_reviews.author: Carol Stepanis

customer_reviews.title: Consistently good product
customer_reviews.text: FARBERWARE is one my favorite cooking products, especially, in terms of Stainless Steel cook ware. ....FARBERWARE is a "tried and true" company, & the products are consistently great! This pan is a perfect size for sauteeing. Plus it has a lid! ....I highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Angeline

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Arrived on time and undamaged. Works well and gets me away from aluminum pans.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: A large pan to hold everything!
customer_reviews.text: I already own a lot of Faberware. This was an easy decision. I needed a large fry pan and I really try to cook mostly with stainless steel. This pan is big enough and the height is just right to cook a large amount of vegetables. I make large meals and the two pans I use a lot is the Faberware 12 quart stock pot and this pan. It is easy to clean and great for cooking. Amazon once again came through with great products and good resellers.
customer_reviews.author: J. Gearhart

customer_reviews.title: Just like my other pieces this is a wonderful pan
customer_reviews.text: I wrote other reviews on the Farberware I purchased. Just like my other pieces this is a wonderful pan. Heavy weight but not to heavy to handle. Cooks evenly....love it!
customer_reviews.author: Cindy

customer_reviews.title: Very nice set
customer_reviews.text: This covered frypan is just what I wanted. No non-stick surface to worry about, cooks, steams & fries food. No problems and I love having the cover. The price is right, too.
customer_reviews.author: Anon

customer_reviews.title: GOOD BUT NOT
customer_reviews.text: PAN IS VERY HEAVY. COOKS FOOD WELL AS LONG AS YOU SPRAY THE HECK OUT OF THE PAN. CLEAN IMMEDIATLEY OR YOU WILL BE SCRUBBING FOREVER
customer_reviews.author: Brooke Steines

customer_reviews.title: I would have given this skillet 5 * except for ...
customer_reviews.text: I would have given this skillet 5 * except for the method used for attaching the handle. Spot welds are not near as durable for high stress "drops" as stainless steel screws. If your handle breaks off, you'll have some work to do.
customer_reviews.author: ramblingalp

customer_reviews.title: Durable
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Replaced one of my mother's after the handle was wearing off, after many many, many years of repetitive use.
customer_reviews.author: Rufus Edmonds Jr

customer_reviews.title: Love my Farberware 12 inch pan!
customer_reviews.text: Love my Farberware 12 inch pan.... It matches perfectly with my other Farberware pots/pans that I have had for over 50 years. Only one 50 yr old pot had a hole in it from using it all the time. I am in love with Farberware; it's a big endorsement for Farberware quality of a cooking ware.
customer_reviews.author: Nonna

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Pan
customer_reviews.text: I love this pan, can be heavy but it has a extra handle to help you out. Easy to clean and well made
customer_reviews.author: ItterlyM

customer_reviews.title: Farberware Classic Stainless Steel
customer_reviews.text: The handle gets loose all the time which is very irritating. Reason my overall score is a 4
customer_reviews.author: Minerva Regales

customer_reviews.title: A classic pan.  A lifelong favorite
customer_reviews.text: This is the most used pan in my collection. Actually, this is the third one I have purchased from this manufacturer in forty years! The previous two had the same broken handle problem where the screw loosens and cannot be repaired. But this pan is a workhorse. It is sturdy, cleans up beautifully... I couldn't be without it. Great price .
customer_reviews.author: Turtleview

customer_reviews.title: Super Pan
customer_reviews.text: Great value. Spreads heat evenly across the pan bottom; the main reason we bought this with the aluminum clad bottom. Would buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce W. Bucholtz

customer_reviews.title: Handle Broke Off
customer_reviews.text: The handle on one of the sautéed pans just broke off. I was hoping to return that one but it says it’s too late to return it. Which I don’t agree with. This item should last many years not two months.
customer_reviews.author: Caroline B.

customer_reviews.title: Farberware RULES!
customer_reviews.text: I had Farberware Classic before it was a "classic". I received it in 1970 as a wedding gift and used it for twenty years. I then changed to another brand and quickly discarded that brand for a new set of Farberware Classic. The quality is awesome and the prices are very reasonable. I won't use anything else, I've learned my lesson! When you have the best, don't shop around!
customer_reviews.author: Sharon Warner

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I love all my Farberware pans and skillets. They are the greatest and will last a lifetime,
customer_reviews.author: Lynn

customer_reviews.title: Farberware Fan two
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this pan to supplement the 10 piece classic collection. I didn't realize the pan was so big. I have a glass cooktop and the pan is much bigger than the biggest burner. This isn't a problem if what I am cooking has a sauce (e.g. goulash or chicken&dumpings), however, if I am frying something I need to keep to the center of the pan. Still, I have learned how to make use of the different heat zones and like using this pan.
customer_reviews.author: Shelley

customer_reviews.title: Can do better
customer_reviews.text: The handle gets loose a lot ... could be better.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great products that last!
customer_reviews.text: Gave as a gift to mother in law. We have had ours since we were married more than 30 years and they have held up well. She loved it and I am certain it will last her for as long as she needs a skillet.
customer_reviews.author: T4wheeler

customer_reviews.title: Versatile & dependable... I love it!
customer_reviews.text: My favorite rice pilaf Pan! My son took my first one when he moved out so I had to buy another one!
customer_reviews.author: Nanshan

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality.
customer_reviews.text: Cover was received dented in by the knob. Poorest quality Farberware I've ever purchased. The inside cooking surface discolored after 3 uses. I was very disappointed
customer_reviews.author: BHT

customer_reviews.title: Functional and durable
customer_reviews.text: It is definitely not as well made as my older one from 20 years ago, but it is functional and is holding up well
customer_reviews.author: rob

customer_reviews.title: Sticky Situation
customer_reviews.text: I have different Farberware pans but, I am very dissatisfied with this one. Everything that I cook in it, no matter what the temperature is, sticks. I am guessing, the pans are not made with the same quality of steel as years ago. Disappointing for sure :(
customer_reviews.author: joyouspraises

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: This was as advertised & I received it quickly. Nice frypan.
customer_reviews.author: Marcheta M. Fitzsimmons

customer_reviews.title: Not really 10 inches...
customer_reviews.text: Just received this today, and am mildly disappointed to find that it measures 9 1/2 inches across, not 10 inches as the box says. I had been hoping to use the heavy glass lid from my old 10 inch pan, but obviously can't. Also, the metal lid that comes with this pan does not seem to be really tight fitting - the lid isn't heavy enough to really press down and there's a bit of play - not close to a press fit & will probably let steam escape readily. Not enough reason to send this back at this price, but annoying misrepresentation. On the plus side, really nice finishing & well made.
customer_reviews.author: Mary  H.

customer_reviews.title: 12' Frypan
customer_reviews.text: After using the pan, I find that the handle loosens up from the handle. Every time I use it it comes loose. Not a very good set up for such a heavy pan. Other than that, I like the pan. The handles are good on a smaller pan such as a 1 or 2 quart pan.
customer_reviews.author: Ron Hens

customer_reviews.title: Lasts forever
customer_reviews.text: I have been us Farberware for 50 years It has never let me down. Have new induction stove which it is perfect for.
customer_reviews.author: Inga H Avitabile

customer_reviews.title: The Best Frypan for Everyday Use
customer_reviews.text: I have a larger one just like it that I have used for many years. I love the fact that it is so easy to clean and although it is not a "non-stocl" surface, I have never had any trouble with food sticking, and it is so easy to wash. I can use a regular spatula or other tools without fear of damaging it. I would recommend for everyone as an all puirpose frypan.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Lou Hayes

customer_reviews.title: great size, price, performance
customer_reviews.text: I used to have this pan and gave it up to my daughters. I missed the size so ordered it again. Very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: I love it!
customer_reviews.text: I love it, I love it, I love it and I plan on purchasing the smaller skillets too!
customer_reviews.author: LyndaZ

customer_reviews.title: Nice supplement to our 12" Classic pan
customer_reviews.text: We have a 12" Classic Farberware frying pan and wanted to get another to cook other things simultaneously (e.g., pancakes in one, eggs in the other). This fit the bill perfectly. We have been very pleased with it so far.
customer_reviews.author: MRH

customer_reviews.title: Top notch pan
customer_reviews.text: Nice and heavy. Size good for one large steak. Very sturdy handle. Cover fits well
customer_reviews.author: Clarinda B.

customer_reviews.title: Product use
customer_reviews.text: Skillet is large and great for marina sauce or gravy, which require frequent stirring. Handles a whole small chicken for frying. Sticks badly for chicken-fried steak, noodle dishes, and alfredo sauce, even when pre-coating with canola or olive oil. Overall does the job for large one-dish meals.
customer_reviews.author: Centaur55

customer_reviews.title: One drawback: very heavy
customer_reviews.text: After ruining a 50+ yr. old Revere ware pan this size, I opted for this product, and I'm glad I did. But understand that the extra handle is meant to be used. I found that this product lives up to its promises - you need less gas or a lower setting on an elecric range to get the same results. This gets hot slowly, but stays hot a long time, so you have to be sure to set it to the right spot the first time. I make massive quantities of spaghetti sauce in this, the straight and high sides help to make that happen without a mess on the stove.
customer_reviews.author: Judith Rosenthal Schwartz

customer_reviews.title: Quality and good looks too
customer_reviews.text: Just what is needed to prepare that family dinner or for guests. Quality and good looks too.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: ideal light weight fast heating skillet
customer_reviews.text: From when my mother 40 years ago (who sold cookware) gave me a set of Farberware, it was still going strong when I had to move long distance so gave it away in great condition. Now I'm back to replacing the best cookware on the market!
customer_reviews.author: Linda N.

customer_reviews.title: Have used this brand for over 40 years...
customer_reviews.text: Farberware classics are just that. A simple, classic style pan and cover that not only looks good but holds up to years of use and abuse, except of course if left to long unattended on high heat setting.
customer_reviews.author: Jean S

customer_reviews.title: High quality
customer_reviews.text: I bought to replace my 30 year old Farberware frying pan. High quality and it will hopefully last 30 years like my other frying pan.
customer_reviews.author: meganajjcec

customer_reviews.title: It looks beautiful but...
customer_reviews.text: This pan is nice because of it's size and the lid. My only issue with it is that the handles are spot-welded on there. I'm sure they wouldn't break off under even heavy use, but, they sure look like they would. I saw some other covered pans like this and they had these huge rivets that looked indestructible. This pan sure does look nice, though. Very traditional looking and I enjoy using it, just the handles could have been attached on there a little better. Not made in USA.
customer_reviews.author: Carson

customer_reviews.title: Way too heavy.
customer_reviews.text: I like the size of this skillet but it's way too heavy for me to lift to pour out of such as with a gravy. It does have a small handle on the other side but very awkward to use. Would not purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Tootyms

customer_reviews.title: great frypan, even though this 10" new frypan is ...
customer_reviews.text: great frypan, even though this 10" new frypan is smaller than the 10" Farberware frypan I got 40 years ago - I guess they measure differently now.
customer_reviews.author: momsdolls

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I love cooking with this pan because it's so well constructed​ with quality materials.
customer_reviews.author: MarLo

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Note - this pan is HEAVY. Performs really well, but a bit much for my wife to handle.
customer_reviews.author: SoundGuy

customer_reviews.title: My favorite skiillet
customer_reviews.text: I lost my 25 year plus Farberware skillet to an unfortunate cooking incident. I knew that I could count on Amazon when I was looking for a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Marilyn

customer_reviews.title: Farberware has been occupying my cupboards for 58 years, ...
customer_reviews.text: Farberware has been occupying my cupboards for 58 years, and is still in nearly new condition! This frypan with lid is a gift for my granddaughter.
customer_reviews.author: Always Learning

customer_reviews.title: Great pan
customer_reviews.text: Nothing like farberware. Use it everyday. Big. For family dinners can't be beat
customer_reviews.author: Pat S

customer_reviews.title: Two stars because the handle will not stay tightly attached ...
customer_reviews.text: Two stars because the handle will not stay tightly attached. Farberware said they will look into (with no guarantee that they will replace it) it if I send it back at my expense, which is nearly a third of the original price. I'll be sure to research my next pan purchase to see if it has recurring complaints, as this one does.
customer_reviews.author: claire lindell-key

customer_reviews.title: Love This Fry Pan
customer_reviews.text: Love Farberware so when my 40 yrs old fry pan's handle came off and could not be fixed I knew I had to get another to replace it. This fry pan is wonderful, food does not stick in it.
customer_reviews.author: Marla L. Borman

customer_reviews.title: Great frying pan
customer_reviews.text: This frying pan is a lot heavier than the 10" one, so the extra handle is a big help! It's another great Farberware product!
customer_reviews.author: momsdolls

customer_reviews.title: Faberware frypan
customer_reviews.text: I have used Faberware pans all my married life [45 years]. This frypan is just the right size to fit my needs. I like it very much.
customer_reviews.author: Ruth A. Schaffer

customer_reviews.title: Product Availability
customer_reviews.text: I was delighted to find the exact frying pan I was looking for, but couldn't find in the stores. All the Farberware products in stores are covered with teflon or are treated in some other way. Thank heavens they're still making the product I remember, and thank you Amazon, for carrying it!
customer_reviews.author: Bronxie

customer_reviews.title: Just what you're looking for!
customer_reviews.text: Great cook wear and solidly made. Would buy again if needed.
customer_reviews.author: Wi Fi Pro

customer_reviews.title: Good Product
customer_reviews.text: I looked locally and could not find a stainless steel skillet without a lining. I am very pleased with the skillet from Farberware. It really is a classic. It really meets the need that I had.
customer_reviews.author: Joyce A Miller

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Love this frypan. Very sturdy. Can't beat Farberware classic series.
customer_reviews.author: Gogo

customer_reviews.title: Too Big
customer_reviews.text: It's a nice pan, but too big for my electric stove top. I'm sure it would be just fine on a gas burner.
customer_reviews.author: Sandrah B.

product_meta.title: Farberware Classic Stainless Steel Saute Fry Pan with Lid, 2.75 Quart, Silver
product_meta.description:
Size:2.75 QuartThis Farberware Classic Series Stainless Steel Sauté Pan with Lid goes instantly from cooking a fast breakfast in the morning to preparing family frypan meals at night. Farberware has been trusted for over 100 years, and this frying pan continues that tradition for a new generation. A full cap base featuring a thick aluminum core surrounded by stainless steel provides rapid, even heating, whether basting eggs or sautéing zucchini and squash. The frying pan is constructed of heavy-duty stainless steel polished to a mirror finish for a classic touch, and the comfortable handle with iconic styling provides a confident grasp. This pan works perfectly for making a weeknight dinner of Sloppy Joes or caramelizing onions and peppers with Italian sausage. A self-basting lid helps seal in heat and flavor, and the fry pan is dishwasher safe and oven safe to 350°F. Cooks who love the versatility and durability of other pots and pans from Farberware will find all kinds of uses for this big frying pan with lid. Prepare tried-and-true family favorites and create enticing new dishes with this Farberware Classic Series Stainless Steel 2.75-Quart Sauté Pan with Lid.

AMAZON.COM
Functional as well as beautiful, this 10-inch frying pan is made of heavy 18/10 stainless steel polished to a mirror finish. The pan has an aluminum core in its base to spread heat quickly and evenly. The core is completely clad in stainless steel so, like the rest of the pan, the bottom resists corrosion and discoloring and cleans up easily. Thick rolled rims add durability and make it possible to pour from the pan without dripping. Because the pan is 2-1/2 inches deep and comes with a tight-fitting, domed lid, it is roomy enough to fry chicken and sauté vegetables but can also be used for braising red cabbage and pork chops or for cooking chili on the stovetop or in the oven. (The handles are oven safe to 350 degrees F and stay cool on the stovetop.) The pan is dishwasher-safe and comes with a lifetime warranty against defects. --Fred Brack
feature_bullets: STAINLESS STEEL SAUTE PAN: 2.75-quart sauté pan with lid doubles as a large, deep frying pan for one pan meal making
FAST, EVEN HEATING FRY PAN: A full cap base on the sauté pan features a thick aluminum core surrounded by stainless steel for rapid, even heating
BRILLIANT SHINING COOKWARE: The sauté pan's heavy-duty stainless steel is polished to a mirror finish for a classic touch; the self-basting lid helps seal in heat and moisture
STOVE TO OVEN EASY: Frypan is oven safe to 350 degrees F; comfortable handle with iconic styling provides a confident grasp
EASY CLEANING SAUTE: This dishwasher-safe sauté pan combines technology with the styling and quality that Farberware has delivered for decades
